_qdhY50RNMCuiCrHCnNpkA.text: They just changed the menu and it is not as great as the past one !! We were disappointed because the place seemed bigger and cosier. sthis is really a cafe to have a quick lunch. In the new menh they have No salads!!

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom

gElOU54n9ApWhbOqaKKQ4A.text: Super nice people with great service, amazing food, nice playlist, and excellent coffee. What more could you ask from a neighbourhood cafe? I very highly recommend the brioche French toast with caramelised peaches and ginger cream. The smashed avocado with chilli chutney is terrific, as well. But you can't go wrong. Enjoy.

D4C7eY-SyNNGSH8aXGxSrw.text: Was looking for a cozy brunch spot with some bomb french toast and found just that.  Got there on the earlier side at 10 am which was good, because it got quite busy shortly after.  Got a Chai tea latte (yummy, but could have been hotter- it was strangely luke warm), but the food was fantastic.  The brioche french toast was savory and filling.  Also got the smoked corn and pancetta hash with an extra poached egg,bacon and avacado which was a generous portion. Left feeling full and strangely healthy since their ingredients and preparation was not the usual greasy diner food.  A lovely little brunch spot!

fv-X2zrMlIM3_zHloc-q1A.text: I was so so excited to see that Friends of Ours had come to our neighborhood! My first visit to the cafe was in a rush on the way to an appt, but I couldn't resist stopping in and seeing what I could grab as takeaway - The team whipped up the smashed avocado with chilli chutney and smoked bacon and after one bite I knew this would be a brand new love affair.  My second visit didn't go as great - my partner and I popped over for Saturday brunch around 12:30PM - the cafe was buzzing and I promised myself I would try something else from the menu and went for the sweet potato and courgette rosti.  Though a different and nice taste, it couldn't compete with the avocado order (which my partner ordered and said was a under overripe).  The service seemed to be quite new to it so we had a wait quite a while to get our orders and the check - but still a very friendly crew.  We watched a couple next to us receive the wrong dish which the team was very apologetic for and offered some homemade chocolates on the house (not typical in London!).  Coffee-wise: I wasn't a massive fan of my latte - which again seemed to be churned out rather quickly and not given some of the attention of the millions of coffee houses in Shoreditch. As i'm still enamoured with my first taste of the homemade chili chutney I won't write off Friends of Ours just yet. I also had a chance to interact with the team a bit and am excited for the concept and have quite a few different menu items to still try. I'm sure once they get more in the swing of their increasing neighborhood popularity this will be an even bigger hit!

5Nx-RMmMN_y5yID89XrFvQ.text: The friendliest employees and really good music and more importantly, great coffee and food!

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Granola and yogurt and Benedict

y1CS0A5gcezOMm9nLqeFdA.text: Happened to stumble into this wonderful place when I was staying nearby on Haberdasher St. Immediately I was impressed by Man and his Barista, Tony who were warm and welcoming. This space has an open ambience with a great fit-out to match. Ordered scrambled eggs on toast with mushroom and avocado, all exceptional. On a second visit, Man recognised me, addressed me by name, shook my hand and had recalled my order from several days earlier. Best customer service I've experienced across many recent cafe visits in Sydney, LA, NYC and London. 'Friends of ours' feels an appropriate name at this point.Just to top it off, coffee is fantastic and nice to see Bonsoy being used, unlike some of the questionable substitutes I've had recently at a similar price point.Highly recommended!

JaZINd_8DjDXbU_QN0BHZA.text: Friends of Ours is another happy, friendly anecdote to the teeming infestation of surly, uninterested baristas of East London.I hugely prefer drip coffees over espresso-based coffees, and I'm often met with an annoyed look when I ask about these options. I either get a "um, no" or, at best. "ugh, you know that takes 5 minutes, right?".... so I'm extremely pleased that another cafe in my neck of the woods has V60 / aeropress options and are knowledgeable, passionate, and super friendly about 'em too!I've not had brunch or any proper meals here, but their nibbles are on point y'all.Highly recommended! :)

NmPU24B76F35pR-AqjjjQQ.text: Bathroom Hasn't Been Cleaned in YearsI had a ham croissant and a flat white for lunch here, and they were both okay, but when I saw the bathroom, I wanted to vomit it all back up.There was blood on the toilet seat, feces smeared around the inside, and the sink and toilet brush were covered with dust and grime that made it clear that this room is simply NEVER cleaned.As famous chef Anthony Bourdain says, "I won't eat in a restaurant with filthy bathrooms. They let you see them. If they can't be bothered to clean the toilet, just imagine what their refrigerator looks like."

D3GWKdTQm4y6rrciHmkCcg.text: What a great little cafe! Excellent local brewed coffee and great breakfast and lunch selection. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Cakes are out of this world too
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Awesome steak from Friends of Ours! Really great service and good atmosphere 5*

bNzWIMkdL5ekNm6IGjG1SQ.text: I have to say that this was one of the best eggs Benedict that I've eaten since I arrived in London. You could tell that everything was homemade and the coffee was out of this world, where you even got a shot of some coffee water to drink before your actual coffee. Props I the fact that they had almond milk and also let us stay there for a very long time after we had eaten! The staff was extremely kind and I have never seen anyone make coffee so carefully! Definetly going back!

noRV9l65uC_X8HrhV7giSw.text: The best brunch I've put in my mouth in East London - and that is a strong claim. In fact, I've been back three weeks in a row, and dragged friends along to it too.Popped away back on Pitfield St (which should be renamed Brunch Row), it's a neat little cafe with light decor and plenty of small tables. You can sit outside too. And, best of all, it understands that brunch on a weekend should really be served all day long, as the ability to get out of bed before 11am is severely limited. They serve amazing (Ozone) coffee - their flat white is perfect - along with more unusual drinks like matcha lattes. They also do beautiful smoothies - which you can have with almond milk to make dairy free - and juices. Carrot, ginger & orange juice has cured my cold for good. As for the food - it's stunning. Avocado on toast has been remixed with sweet chili chutney, and served with a soft poached egg. It's their best selling dish and you have to try it. The salmon (fresh in as a special on that day) benedict was juicy and thick on an English muffin with spinach and dill hollandaise. The breakfast skillet comes piping hot, with eggs studded with chorizo and beans. And brioche french toast with ginger cream was thick and sweet. I'm salivating just thinking of it.To top it all off, the service is wonderful - the owners serve you personally and are great for a friendly chat and take such obvious pride in their place.May Friends of Ours be the massive success it deserves to be.

oGxeSf5vU15gYS1Xhgb7wg.text: coffee, ok. Food, not very fan. Service, great. Decoration, small but lovely. Location, great. Suitable for less than 3 people.

6dpWyl7-vvXtO2Lrigi9hQ.text: I've had a couple of flat whites from here and both sucked...probably had to do with the fact that it was served to me literally 30 seconds after I placed the order; it also tasted way over extracted. Maybe the barista was still in training, I don't know ,but nothing annoys me more than third wave coffee shops that don't serve great coffee. Food is okay, but nothing special. Just the usual run-of-the-mill Australian-inspired menu.The owner also wasn't friendly and seemed like he couldn't be bothered when I asked him a question, but maybe he was in a bad mood.

yOrivfkOzX7m8RnGt9p07g.text: The presentation of food here is beautiful. Everything is done with aesthetic care. The soft shell crab brioche sandwich for £13 was so good!

Q_G4NOXHKBEyWJP76Jz8Jg.text: Thank God ! J'ai toujours eu le chic (certains diront la chance) pour rapidement trouver des pépites locales, où que je sois. Car non, je n'ai pas découvert Friends of Ours parce que le lieu est numéro 1 sur Yelp mais bien parce que c'est situé dans mon quartier et sur mon chemin, quand je descends à pied du côté de Shoreditch.   "Nos amis", tribu à laquelle vous aurez l'impression de rapidement appartenir dès que vous aurez poussé la porte d'entrée, est l'un de ces coffee shops londoniens qui a pris le parti, pas le plus simple, de proposer un vrai food menu, frais, inventif et de qualité.   Ici, c'est la culture australienne du breakfast et du brunch qui règne en maître, et multiplie les propositions inventives, que ce soit d'un pain perdu bananes caramel et honeycomb, des beetroots fritters avocat oeuf poché feta, des baked eggs sauce tomate harissa à la coriandre, des gaufres aux pêches rôties et pistaches, ou encore le brunch muffin aux épices indiennes ou des oeufs accompagnés du saumon fumé maison et l'un ou l'autre posh labneh ou tahini.   Vous avez l'embarras du choix pour voyager culinairement dès le saut du lit, tout en vous injectant votre première dose quotidienne d'excellent café, puisque que le lieu est aussi un specialty coffee shop, utlisant les grains torréfies par Dark Arts.  Si certains de vos amis sont plus conservateurs dans leur envies matinales, Friend of Ours dispose d'une gamme de jolies pâtisseries et cakes maison. C'est presque regrettable car chaque fois que j'y vais, je mange "à la carte" et dois alors renconcer à ces petites tueries disposées sur le comptoir.   Le cadre est épuré, légère tendance hip-psychédélique, via les tableaux d'artistes locaux aux murs et la playlist est du même accabit. Un vrai équilibre de branchouillitude non prétentieuse et de convivialité, dont la pierre angulaire reste la maîtrise de la cuisine et du café.  La terrasse permet de profiter du soleil quand il daigne se montrer, au milieu de ce quartier vert et calme de l'est londonien. Pitfields Street est en effet un petit oasis de tranquillité lové entre la hi-tech Shoreditch et le hipster Hackney.  Friends of Ours est un stand-out parmi la liste prolifique des coffee shops et des établissements axés brunch de Londres et sa réputation est amplement méritée.  Amenez-y les friends of yours pour leur faire découvrir autre chose que le sempiternel et so french triptique croissant-baguette-Nutella et démarrer ainsi la journée de la meilleure des manières.  Enjoy !

hQWTDkgEcfLzMWiVJoziyg.text: Boy am I lucky. Stayed around the corner from this lovely little place while visiting London, and it was a treaaat. Their Royale was eggcellent, refreshing hollandaise on two perfectly poached eggs on a hardy piece of toast. Good cold brew coffee too. Well deserved reputation.

sQ7N8hVH7kZml0ek1c6oYQ.text: Amazing Croque Madame and pulled pork with red cabbage. Portions were pretty filling, beautifully served. Highly recommended!

BCK14HZPFE62p15T57tymA.text: My wife and I stopped here for breakfast and really enjoyed it. I had the one man pan and it was outstanding. Great food, and the people working there are awesome. Highly recommended.

aJyuazCGIDNwrbmxf9qiBA.text: I don't remember when I ate such a good slow cooked pulled pork. And the coffee from aero press... just great! Oh, and don't forget to get carrot cake alongside the coffee, its yummy!

ji6RG0aNN-GQYCXKwreHMg.text: Food cooked with quality ingredients and lots of love! The owners and staff are the nicest possible and really made us feel like friends of theirs. We will be back often!

9wxN5tjk9VVgS8rERdXUEQ.text: Yum! This place has a cool vibe, reminds me a lot of the Lower East Side in Manhattan. Urban face and style with great coffee and brunch style food.The American connection carries on with the menu, options such as meat hash, crawfish benedict and anything with avocado all staples.For me I went with the Pork belly roll, served on a lovely fresh ciabata roll with yuzu mayo and watercress salad. Tasty well cooked belly slices with the sharp yuzu were a lovely match. Tremendously tasty and served with a well made flat white this wont be my last visit to this little US outpost.

qej-j09ZeP1mVqwQJJvQew.text: Great menu, charming and delightful staff, and a nice atmosphere.  Will definitely eat here again soon.

liJGaY7VmqACU6bHUb6TWw.text: Really love this little place, a really great brunch spot or even if you want to swing by for a quick coffee! The atmosphere in here is relaxed but service is quick. The food quality is excellent - I highly recommend the eggs benedict. The coffee is also great and the servers are very friendly. I love the fact they stock crosstown donuts too!

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict

XZ-TA8TapfUWNsCe834BbQ.text: Everything served here is delicious but cold - coffee or food. If you like both served hot as opposed to lukewarm like myself you will leave this place underwhelmed. Food temperature is not always a consideration for me but our total for 2 ppl for brunch was £45 and so we felt everything should have been perfect.

EHVCW6S_P6_UIzlOg46TIQ.text: Excellent in every way! A fresh and friendly scene that warms me up again to hipster love, with dishes so good it made me think I was back in San Francisco. You'll find culinary art met with exquisite taste and great music and art on the walls, a delight for all your senses. Bravo Nuevo-London.

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast for the discerning

Fd7qZbefoU13WI6soLpMzw.text: Food was great, and service really nice. Cute spot for Sunday brunch with friends.

oR2daJ58qvVOcej0eYWxLQ.text: I stopped here for a flat white this afternoon directly after lunch. Oh, how I wish I could go back in time and forgot my lunch to have eaten here! The coffee that I did have though, was nice. Beautifully presented and silky. The staff were some of the best I have ever encountered in London- friendly, welcoming, helpful and genuinely complimentary. I will return to try some of the dishes I saw being served because they were visually stunning and inventive. Yum.

gpLwLNvA9HNUo9j0r1VmIw.text: Extraordinary! The food is really incredible. I'm not not really a fan of fusion cuisine (at least not normally) but this place makes me want to start exploring it more. The barista is also amazing. Exemplary chai and flat white. Attentive but comfortably casual service, very reasonable prices. In the heart of a great neighborhood (keep your eyes peeled for Banksy and Shepard Fairey within a block of each other. Shoreditch is definitely street art paradise). Back to the place - you can make reservations on their website, but in our experience it wasn't necessary. My wife and I went here twice with only three days in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Masterful barista. Tastes even better than it looks.
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Charming, clean interior

7k7uH7asOLZU9IuD_bkgxA.text: We're very well fed when we visited for lunch. Great food and service. My new favourite for the area.

EpZxopn3ywssZrAIUWLMKg.text: Cosy cafe within walking distance of Old Street station. Coffee was good, not too bitter. The highlight of brunch was the home made crumpets. They were soft, doughy & very buttery, tasted like they were straight out of the oven. Peanut butter & berry preseve was on point, a good mix of sweet & salty- definitely wanted more peanut butter. Staff were very friendly. My visit was midweek, I imagine this place gets busy over the weekend so come early.

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Homemade crumpets with salted caramel peanut butter & preserve
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Cafe bar

dc_bk219naY3Z4nZtPuwkQ.text: Walked in and got a seat straight away, staff were very pleasant. Ambiance and music was delightful. I ordered a flat white and asked what to get for food because I couldn't decide. Server said eggs Benedict was the most popular so long as I'm not vegetarian. It came out soon after my flat white and was delicious. Would recommend to friends visiting the Shoreditch/ East London area for a quick and nice breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict and flat white, excuse the snapchat text as this was the only picture I have!

cSSuSM8nY6HSI3NIjEYcWw.text: Super cosy and friendly! The eggs were poached perfectly and the slow roasted Rwandan coffee was perfectly bitter but balanced with a sweet cherry aftertaste. Good portion size for a good price

wftB_hNmaDBUxAXYe9Aa-w.text: Super nice team, and the most delicious breakfast I've had in London so far. Simple fare, but executed with care and beauty. If you're looking for a breakfast place, look no further!

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Pork belly Benedict
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Crumpets with figs, goat cheese, and honey.

-0rnEgtsSSFWBMClXliqCw.text: the look of the cafe were spot on but the food not that special , for me that cake not worth the taxi ride i have paid

46XedaYOtBg4th5v_7oaJQ.text: Very good and eclectic variety of food. We came here for breakfast and got the eggs benedict with smoked ham and the pork congee. Both plates were flavorful and unique. The smoked ham was delicious and perfectly cooked eggs went well with the toast and hollandaise sauce. The congee was very different than anything we'd ever tried but also very good. Great service too.

2mdMJriSjK2kalhGmzR1Fw.text: Best overall brunch experience I've had in London! Run by really friendly wonderful people that recommended the perfect dishes to us. Their eggs benedict is the best I've ever had and their carrot and beetroot fritters were pretty special too. Their flat white coffee was also excellent and they put in special effort to make lovely designs with the froth. We ended our meal with their brownie which was juuust right. Perfectly gooey and not too sweet. It's one of those meals that leaves you feeling happy for the rest of the day. Can't really ask for much more.

xQBHSvydEhF_8GqQTHZHmg.text: PERFECT. Shoutout to the lovely Colleen C for the reco -- if I lived anywhere nearby, this would be my go-to spot for coffee, breakfast, lunch, brunch, and everything in between. It's a tiny little place, so don't bring your whole crew. But what they may lack in size they totally make up for with fantastic people, a gorgeous interior, delicious food, and tons of heart. When I first walked in, the two gents working were incredibly helpful. I truly felt like they wanted to take care of me. I started with a flat white, which was perfect -- no sugar needed whatsoever. Then when I couldn't decide which of the daily salads I wanted, they offered me a bit of both -- with a side of steak, of course. It was all, once again, perfect. The salads were light and refreshing, and the steak was delicious and cooked exactly how I like it -- medium. Nom freaking nom. They also have lots of baked treats that looked amazing, and Colleen definitely confirmed my suspicion. If you're in Shoreditch, be sure to put this little gem on your must-try list!

ws1f84M9M50GYcU_jM207Q.text: Cozy little place serving extremely tasty coffee. Plenty of space and seating outside. Their flat white is on point!

gD9lgycJFfvG5-rrwj9dyw.text: Two words: Aero Press.These guys just made my weekend coffee decision that much harder, as they know what they're doing with the Ozone beans and they give you a couple different serving options.  To be 100% honest, my wife's first latte wasn't perfect; it had a slight off flavor, maybe from the milk, but her second and my aeropress coffee were both stellar.  Their food is great too - a wide range of breakfast options with plenty of filling, flavorful, even Paleo-friendly options.  My corn fritters were delicious. Combine that with friendly staff and a calm, airy, comfortable space, and Friends of Ours is definitely a great addition to the neighborhood.

Nl1PHvSIGBuvNodX__o1Bw.text: Found this amazing brunch spot and although has only been open for 6 months, it's run like it's been serving customers for yearsFood: French Toast and All Abroad were incredibly presented and tasted out of this worldService: Wonderful; the two owners definitely take pride in service and looking after their patrons - definitely makes the food taste even greater than it already does.100% will be coming back here whenever I'm in London next and would highly recommend it for anyone who's a fan of great food and great service!

WqPxAHGpIRyPnKXxN3n8qw.text: Friends of Ours does a great brunch. The experience starts with welcoming service and cozy table sharing. During the British summer, sitting outside is highly recommended.The menu for food and drinks are both extensive, but not overwhelming, and feature fresh twists on brunch classics. I went with mushrooms on toast with a side of smashed avo. The ensemble was great and plated beautifully (definitely Insta-worthy), but a bit lacking in several respects: you receive a single poached egg you can/must share between the two toasts (and likely contributed to my still being hungry upon leaving), the mushrooms were ample, but under-seasoned, the pesto is potentially the highlight of the meal and was perfectly done.Just a few minutes from Old Street station but off of busy streets, the atmosphere and solid brunch are sure to bring me back.

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom

4oQFjvW3ODzvYQXv9CnqvA.text: Wowsers! Brunch date heaven right here!I got tempted into a visit after a flow of stylish fully crafted Instagram pictures on my feed. I'm not a 'foodie' but I have to admit I was very tempted.Definitely not disappointed and neither was my foodie flat mate!Harrisa hummus, feta and poached eggs led me into a delightful food coma! Absolutely delicious paired with a perfect matcha latte :)A very busy brunch location, we ended up sharing our table with a cute British couple whom we shared a bottle of water with and a delightful American duo who were just happy to be In London- I'm always a fan of a location that encourages communal dining!100% recommend this perfect lunch brunch date location with excellent food, drinks, service and unexpected company :)

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom

XZqGd_kdXdbqOnnO4wjzIA.text: The coffee and food here is so good! I really like how they have a whole menu of food. Just the right amount of variety where you feel there are enough options to make a good decision but also not too long so that you don't know what to get. I got the latte and ham with poached eggs with hollandaise sauce mmmmmm the touch of snow pea leaves was so yummy. The atmosphere and interior is very relaxed and the sunlight coming in from the big windows creates the perfect spot for a brunch or resting spot for coffee and a snack.

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Latte and tap
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Ham with poached egg and hollandaise sauce

lO5wu1HPCjJdLQKrbXEzRA.text: Gluten free toast upped my smashed guac and poached eggs to spectacular.  Tanzanian filter coffee topped it off for a great start to the day.  Good tunes. Friendly staff.  Buzzing wee place. I'm happy we stopped by.

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Perfectly poached eggs & generous smashed avocado for my GF towst

1NRlcVk4Cr7CAxR9DoQd_A.text: ....and OPEN!I've been passing by Friends of Ours every day for what seems like eternity, anticipating their opening. YES! A lovely new cafe on Pitfield Street that inhabits a formerly (long) shuttered fried chicken shop. So much upgrade going on here, my friends. Friends of Ours. Friends of MINE! We stopped in for a few coffees Saturday morning and it was pleasantly plump with chattering brunchers. I like what I see. My flat white was delicious -- made superbly, and using Ozone Coffee. Again, I'm going all fangirl over here. I'm justsoexcitedforthisplace. It's a small shop -- comfortable seating for about 20 with takeaway coffee and pastries. The cafe serves quite nice dishes as well (I had serious egg envy of the gentlemen eating in the window) -- and I am confident I'll be back many many days to indulge in their menu. For now a flat white, but I've got a 5-star bet on this place. Passionate people doing great things, and in my street? Welcome!

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Carrot orange and ginger fresh juice
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom

ow_kvoh8yKz1v4qvuoNVEg.text: I like this place a lot. Great coffee, food and vibe. Can't ask for much more. Walked by here on Saturday and I had to come back and try it the next day.I really like places that have the Aussie aesthetic, which is all about bright, simple, airy spaces. It's very relaxing in here and the owners and staff are so nice. They came around to talk to us and were so friendly.I ordered the scrambled eggs with chili and bacon on sourdough. My friend ordered the breakfast skillet. Both were excellent, as was my soy latte. They use Ozone Coffee. This is great because I hate Ozone's food, so now I can just come here and it's closer to my place.The orange juice as fresh, definitely try that and make room for the carrot cake! Oh my we were eyeing that the entire time and decided to go for it when the couple next to us recommended it. It was worth it. However, that and the second lattes tipped me over the edge and I had to walk off the brunch and then come home and lie down. Major food coma!I'll be back. Very often. Like this place a lot.

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Love the black La Marzocco
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Symmetry lattes
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Scrambled eggs with bacon and chili on sourdough bread

2xVYQBMHCBP4sj6KDF0dVw.text: As typical Australian brunch lovers, the 4.5 stars given to Friends of Ours on Yelp meant it was a must go. The cafe was quite crowded when we went, giving a slight cramped and uncomfortable feel. We decided on the beetroot and corn fritters following recommendations that we do so. Presentation was lovely and fresh, and the balance of flavours was done nicely. However the fritters themselves were quite doughy and hard to swallow. There was a wide selection of pastries from the counter ranging from Anzac biscuits to carrot cake. Overall, the meal was satisfying and tasty. Does it deserve such a high rating? Based upon my visit alone, probably not.

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom

gKEacSZ7TqaOUZ7mrVc45A.text: Friends of ours = breakfast heaven especially for those who are partial to shellfish, avocado and Asian influences. It is also bloody brilliant for sweet toothed breakfast enthusiasts or coffee fiends. And egg crazy, sourdough fans. Ok, it suits anyone who eats or drinks. Menu changes seasonally. At the moment crab on toast with AV and a poach egg addition is rocking my world. They also have ramen after 11:30 which was unlike any ramen I have ever had. Yum. Lobster with wasabi hollandaise and eggs, baked mexi eggs. Crumpets with all of the beautiful trimmings. Everything is good!Their coffee is from NZ coffee roasters, now London locals, ozone coffee and the place it's self is riddled by Aussie staff who are genetically used to getting up pre 8am on purpose so they are always friendly and fun to have a chat to.Not a huge amount of seating so if you have to wait DO IT. Totally worth it. Get yourself a takeaway coffee and your loyalty card and hover over someone with empty plates. Yum

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Lobster benedict- available on weekends only. Homemade hollandaise wow
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Love this menu!

rcX13fw1xIY8PqsR_FQi3g.text: Okay, after seeing Friends of Ours with their shining 5* rating every time I logged into Yelp, I had to go. We're they that good - or was it another case of Over-Hype-itis. Yes. Yes, they are that good!! Sooo very very good. We got there just after 1pm and it was pretty busy inside. There were about 6 people in the queue and all the members of staff were busy too. However we were acknowledged quickly and a table was available within 10mins! I ordered the smoked trout and my friend ordered the sweetcorn & beetroot fritter. The trout was very fresh and the cuts were chunky. Absolutely delicious with fluffy scrambled eggs.The real winner was the fritters. Oh my what an explosion of flavour! Everything worked out well and the spices were on point. I'm still drooling thinking about this dish. Maybe the best brunch dish I've ever had. That good! Coffee was excellent. Smooth and rich. Impeccable & friendly service.Can't wait to visit again!

Me_I4alDa3OuilNB5ub8_Q.text: That's right a full 5 stars and I don't even drink coffee! I chose this spot for my meeting today based on its reviews and you know what gang? You didn't get it wrong!What a lovely little place. I first want to mention the owner - what a guy. Polite and accommodating from the get go. I walked in and told him I was meeting 3 others, he offered me the large table at the back and then brought me over some water. Half way through our meeting a large group came in so we politely moved seats to a smaller table and the owner helped us with our drinks and thanked us numerous times.Then once I was back on my own, I chose my breakfast - scrambled eggs on toast with a side of bacon. It came literally within 5 minutes and was cooked to perfection. The eggs were fluffy and creamy, bacon crispy but not over done and toast wonderfully crunchy. Ever mouthful was spot on! About 5 mins after I'd finished another group came in and the owner asked if I'd move to another table. I obliged as at the end of the day their a business and I didn't mind budging. The owner came over and thanked me again and offered me a free drink. I refused as I was ready to head but I thought that was very kind of him. I would definite head back here to give some of the other food options a try - they have a great looking baked eggs dish which is just calling my name! Very pleasant morning in a very pleasant coffee shop!

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Scrambled egg on toast with a side of streaky bacon!
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Oreo brownies! Yes please!
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. CAKE!

xhdfiOPtzCCsfXZjgwdy-g.text: A very cute cafe in Hoxton, off Old Street. The eggs benedict were perfect and the thick cut bacon nothing short of amazing. Not sure what the praline crumbs are good for though.Also had a wonderful Chai Pistachio donut for the go.They also have limited seating, so you might have to share a communal table with strangers.

kdBby-S_gzWA1XDDzSOPUA.text: Love this place - on a quiet street off Old Street. The spring menu is incredible, every dish sounds delicious and with a fun twist. Not your average eggs on toast type of place. Good quality, fresh ingredients!The sweetcorn, beetroot fritters were delicious. With bits of golden beetroot, feta, mint & coriander, there was texture and lovely flavour.My friend had the Huevos Motolenos - this looked incredible and is understandably a popular dish. With interesting additions of plantains and arepa bread. Side of smashed avocado which really hit the spot.I will be adding this to my list of brunch places.

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Corn fritters (minus poached egg) Huevos Motolenos

zXjItBuJMkLhfR59N_FIkg.text: I'm pretty sure you can't go wrong with anything on the menu, but I'm still dreaming about their scrambled eggs 2 weeks later. The corn fritters are also really yummy.

_vhmFFGmze-_YmZQYOrScg.text: What a great place for our first breakfast in London! The food was spectacular, the service - warm and cozy. Cannot wait to try more things fromtheir menu!

Kom7EGuMwbe6fXawKwwndQ.text: You're now a friend of mine! I wanted to stay for brunch, however, we were on a schedule, therefore, we had a peanut butter cookie and tea to go. Very good atmosphere for writing and a lot of seating inside. Super friendly service. I did sample some of the beetroot humus = amazing and innovative.

IbegZnxYcKFQ2CrlYL3wag.text: The French Toast was the best I've ever had. I didn't know what honeycomb was until eating here. It was delish!

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. French toast with bacon

PfJCgkDuks7TC9anuA63Qg.text: The reviews here really reflect the solid quality of the food! I wanted the Huevos but the didn't really do a veggie version, so I went for the Harissa dish which I was told tasted similar. My gosh, I could have licked my plate clean, it was so yummy! One of the girls found that her food came cold which upset her, but other than that everyone had a great experience, with especial props for the coffee.  It gets busy, so I totally recommend booking ahead!

ftFw4pPAuQfcrCmyatg1Tw.text: Firstly the food and the staff were great, the only downside is the fact that this place is so popular meaning there are considerable waiting times. We thought we had booked online but this is only an estimated waiting time. At the door we were told it would be a 20 minute wait so we put our names down. After 20 minutes we came back and ended up waiting a further 40 minutes before we got seated (by this point we were throughly frozen). Now this is through no fault of the staff, they kept us notified and it's so unpredictable as people would hold up tables by ordering coffee / desserts after their meals but I think they need to come up with a new system, particularly in the cold weather. Possibly they could take people's numbers and call or text when the table is ready. Unless they change the waiting system I wouldn't really recommend visiting at busy times like the weekend.

9cwhO95G1Apfd-c8r7v6Xw.text: Oh, Friends of Ours is fantastic. I spent a few hours having a working breakfast here last week and the reviews are spot on: great coffee, yummy food, AMAZING friendly service and attention to detail, charm, powerful (and free) wifi... what more can you want?I had my go-to: smashed avocado, which was delicious, plus a pair of skinny flat whites, also excellent. My colleague stayed for lunch and a peak at her salad gave me some serious food envy.We sat at the high table at the back and basically set up shop. Seriously, we had everything required of the urban office: wifi strong enough for a skype call, outlets to recharge... there was even a spare Mac charger was lying around. Though we made copious use of the place, there was no evil eye. Thank you, Friends of Ours! I'll be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Flat white happiness
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Steak, poached eggs, side of smashed avo
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. This is some serious breakfast action

OMoNoB2L95WOAanSaaxiEQ.text: Amazing breakfast!  This is the first spicy meal I've had in weeks and it made me so happy! I've been in Europe for about two weeks and even though I've had  dumplings, Indian curries, and Mexican  food on this trip this is the spiciest and most flavorful meal I've had. Interesting combination of textured and tastes, topped with fresh sprigs of coriander. All while listening to great music...Really brought a smile to my face. Much needed after yesterday's news of the new elected president back at home. Wish I could stay and eat here few more days.

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Aloo Gobi dish, spicy and delicious.

kOCsgJV8F7xYAHFCM7cX5A.text: So difficult to find good scrambled eggs in this city. And with breakfast potatoes to boot! Oh and bacon or haloumi options as well. Good coffee. Quiet neighbourhood. What a gem. Service was just what you'd expect. Food came quickly and warm. I have had such a challenge finding decently prepared juevos, they either come over cooked fried or fried or fried or poached. Good well seasoned eggs. If I'm not clear enough in my review, go check it out. Just above the noise of Shoreditch / Old Street. Outdoor seating. Beirgarten table seating outdoors. Good espresso.

VVSv2IWZZpxV6X6bhxavHw.text: This is a very hip cafe. It has outdoor bench seating and an eclectic menu. You can find fried chicken sandwich next to vegan poke bowl and tofu tacos. I was hoping for more egg dishes but all the plates that I saw looked pretty good.It is on the pricier side though. I got a juice because I was sort of picturing some freshly pressed juice. But it actually came in a small bottle for £4. It tasted pretty good though.

ymv4VGWZnAPXorL_gi6XVg.text: Friends of Ours is a tiny but cute little cafe serving the breakfast of millennials (not complaining!). With the cute benches and limited seating, this is what I always imagined London cafes to look like.After doing some extensive research for the best breakfast in my area (shoreditch), I made my way out here to try their famed avocado toast and matcha. Everything was solid and it would be on daily rotation if I lived in the area, but I didn't think it was anything special. I would recommend it if you're looking to eat brunch al fresco.

eHhFjP_YkCt6T2S5zn-iaQ.text: The perfect little Sunday brunch spot! I'm so happy I went there on my first visit to London. I had the eggs Benedict with beef brisket. Delicious! I'll go back again!

HdBx4naLruw6w6DwIruBdg.text: Such a cute place in the Hoxton residential area so you're far away from the mega touristy breakfast joints. They have brunch ALL day and the staff is just amazing. You can tell he locals love this place because as I sat here there were regulars coming in and out socializing with the two folks working. They have a nice looking menu with great brunch items. I came for breakfast after Instagram stalking them all week and just drooling over their amazing pictures. Even their drinks look beautiful! They have a menu once you walk inside of their iced teas and I was hooked instantly by the Hojicha and Assam iced tea with fresh strawberries, mint, AND a nice grapefruit slice. So incredibly refreshing! And the presentation was legit! I ordered their Ham Hock Benny with mustard hollandaise and potatoes. I liked how the poached eggs were presented on top of the potatoes and there wasn't any bread below. Personally prefer this style! The mustard hollandaise was nice because it was not overpowering with the mustard taste. I can't wait to come back and try more of their menu! Keep up with their IG page to get inspired to come in since they have some amazing menu changes for each season. Also, if the weather is nice sit out on the patio!

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom

iajZrUCeWDABv4bxHld5UA.text: Nice and delicious brunch there !The place is small but looks really comfy and I like it !The staff was friendly nice and very quick to reply to any request.It's not possible to book in advance but for two, you will wait around 10-20 min.The menu is not big but everything is made there.I ordered the week special : chili scrambled with sriracha, Asian style salad on a brioche toast with an oat milk flat white. It was delicious and very fulfill !I totally recommend this place for a nice and warm brunch with friends !

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom

2jp3aQr566hmTycqM88FAA.text: This was such a lovely day to go on my day off. The French toast was out of this world! The ambiance was cute and the cafe itself was small and cozy, with nice outside seating if you prefer the sunshine (or wanted to bring a four legged friend). The staff were friendly and accommodating and I look forward to going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. French toast

smlzj9mLrYTFQ70r0YbbvQ.text: Just THE best. Delicious food, friendly staff, free internet but okay-ish flat white. Came here in the middle of the week so was able to get a table and hang out for a bit. But I can only imagine how crowded it gets on weekends because there isn't really too much seating area.

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom

lmuutEVm8hyFI9qoQvNe8A.text: Such a gem!! My friend and I stumbled up on this place for brunch.  I wouldn't recommend coming here in a large group because it is quite small, but luckily we were only 2 and were able to be seated right away.  We split two mains and had a coffee and a juice each.  It was a perfect brunch

pC-GOJ1Ofbw2HYAuJ-vmZA.text: I do like this place. Had brunch here twice and never had to queue. I think the trick is to go as soon as they open or well in the afternoon.This last time I had. The matcha French toast. Decadent and different from other similar dishes around time.I have to say, for a meal that is full of cliches and 'overused' food, this place manages to keep things fresh and interesting.Highly recommend if you are in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Matcha French toast
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Lovely egg yolk

_vQXt46FdAaYrZ6Ozz-Z2g.text: Friends of Ours... you my favourite. Not only do they have a wonderfully unique list of delicious sounding items on their menu, everything you order turns out positively beautiful! How do you make your food so pretty? And say what? It tastes good too!!! NO WAY! We came here for my friend's birthday lunch and I can say it did not disappoint. All 4 of us ordered something different and everyone cleaned their plates, having something in particular they loved about each one: Smoked Corn and Beetroot Fritters- She really loved the tomato-y sauce that accompanied the whole dish. Trout and Croquettes- She really loved the croquettes, made of sweet potato and deliciousness. Matcha Latte- best matcha latte birthday girl's ever had. I tried it too, it's particularly creamy and yum. Smashed Avocado- I loved that they incorporated beetroot puree with feta puree- it was an amazing combo of flavours. Brunch Muffin- look at that thing! It's ginormous! And then it was all gone, because it was so good. Friends of Ours was an absolute treat and a place I will definitely take my husband, because I need to share this wonderfulness with him.

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Smoked corn and beetroot fritters
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Trout and croquettes
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Matcha latte

S3myGZqy6lsIv_Wv0ooUag.text: This place is always poppin And we live in the area so I wanted to finally try it out. I had the Mediterranean salad option for brunch and an americano. The salad was pretty good just your standard hummus quinoa and carrots. Not really that many vegan options but a great cute place!

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom

Qd274MtaeKzDscSfn7CoVg.text: I can't believe I forgot to do a review of that place. From the outside it looks like your normal cafe, but the food here is much more than regular.I tried the corn fritters, with poached egg, feta and avocado and it was delicious: good combination of flavours.The staff was very friendly with me and my friends - they accomodate some space for her 4 months old daughter.

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom

mFAlMJqzwDqW46IMJqDe4g.text: I had a fried chicken burger and it's the best burger I have ever had in London since I came 6 months ago. Didn't get a pretty picture as I wasn't expect it's so good that I wants to post on Yelp. Must go back to try their brunch next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom

5KtD0P8n4biGl0yAJj88uw.text: Absolutely incredible brunch here. Might well be in my top 3 ever in London. Not withstanding getting a  great spot by the window overseeing when the masses come to find a seat (Come early) but Friendly staff and their star dish of sweet corn and beetroot fritters is sensational. Roasted Golden Beetroot, kasundi, feta, baby mint, smashed avocado, coriander and to top it off a poached egg perched on top it's an amazing dish. I'm a full on carnivore who barely orders a pure veg dish and yes I ordered bacon on the side but you don't need it. The fritter is meaty in texture it's a totally star dish. The ocean trout and scrambled eggs is ace too. And I must shout out the coffee which is superb along with its chai latte.Pretty much now will become my go to place if in in area although I want to test out a few more in area which are highly rated. Well done guys and girls I was so impressed by everything about my experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Must get.

bty7rkTyFOMnSoR7WWXQcw.text: Went in for brunch today and really enjoyed it. The fritters were amazing and so was the French toast. I liked the flat white more than the cappuccino. Service was great and everyone was friendly. Will definitely recommend it

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. French toast was divine

jfxbogUpS-GIWkQGhr2hiA.text: Coffee was so good!! I got the pork belly eggs Benedict and it was amazing. The pork belly had a sweet glaze, and the sweet and salty combo was really good. My friend got the corn and beetroot fritters, very aesthetically pleasing and also delicious. The interior is really cute and homey.

tQFDzmsXuJCJpX7yeqfLgg.text: Wow! Just wow.Coffee was spot on. I tried the filter which was fabulous and then it was the main event - the flat white. My god, when the coffee beans are listed as culture of doom, you'll know it'll be something to shout about and it was!! Yaaaaassss coffee perfection!Food wise, after a mini stalk of their insta, we ordered the beetroot and sweetcorn fritters.. They arrived and just looked breathtaking - a tower of avocado, with purpley fritters and a poached egg just waiting to be cut on the top.. Mmmm what ensued was a yolk drizzled mound of deliciousness!! Oh my word... Simply the dish to travel London for! Our other choice - the trout and scrambled eggs was delicious and was a definite a nice addition to our food.: but for me it's all about the fritters!! A huge shout out for the service! They were super friendly and took time to make recommendations and even advised about which table was best for light to take pictures!! These people know!! 5 star perfection! This is the breakfast that will leave you talking for months after.

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Flat white
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Scrambled eggs
Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Eggtastic

oH-qL_rkSOTaYCB2vZamMQ.text: From the outside, it looks like your classic hypster brunch spot. But it is a lot better than most. The service is warm and caring. The coffee is great. The food menu is creative and very well executed. I had the Sweetcorn & Beetroot Friters which was fantastic - it contains the usual suspects of a brunch (smashed avocado etc.) with a unique (indian-like) twist

photos.caption: Photo of Friends of Ours - London, United Kingdom. Sweetcorn & Beetroot Friters - yumee !

mizDlrPZwlPETq5Z-brXrg.text: Smashing brunch. 1. The options are very creative, far surpassing the usual boring eggs and toast or avo and toast. (Yea there is avo and toast but it comes with smoked beetroot hummus! And feta!) 2. The waitress addressed all my requests, including having the egg fried instead of poached, adding a small helping of the (phenomenal) beetroot hummus as a side at no extra cost and switching out the green drink for a skinny chai latte. All with a smile. I got this: £9"SWEETCORN & BEETROOT FRITTERS"roasted golden beetroot, kasundi, feta, baby mint, poached egg, smashed avocado, coriander (vegetarian) (gluten free)It is awesome. I was worried these would be crunchy fried but they are more like pan-fried. There are two (or three?) fritters stacked atop each other like a tower, with avo in between. It's actually more filling than I thought it would be. The chai latte was mediocre but the food more than made up for it. The place gets packed quick and there's no rez system which stinks but we waited only about 5-10 minutes on a queue outside when we arrived about 11:30am this past Saturday.I also got the lamington and a chocolate chip cookie for takeaway. The cookie in particular, despite being crispy more than chewy (a sin to me), was excellent. It was full of choco chips.
